title: A View of Past and Future Wars on Taiwan
sub_head: The island Japan once colonized may receive its aid in an invasion.
body:
Tongxiao, Taiwan
From atop Tiger Head Mountain on Taiwan’s otherwise flat western coast, colonial Japanese soldiers once scanned the Taiwan Strait, which runs clear to the horizon. Their patience was rewarded in 1905 when the czar’s Baltic Fleet steamed into view, heading to fight in Chinese Manchuria. After a seven-month voyage to the Pacific, Russia’s mighty navy was sunk in less than two days.
